title: What are the benefits of publishing a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, There are so many benefits of publishing a book. Let us look at examples of some well known Indian authors who have benefitted from self-publishing a book. Amish Tripathi, Ashwin Sanghi is some famous Indian authors, for whom publishing a novel has opened many doors. 1. One significant outcome of writing a technical, non-fiction book in your field of expertise is that your standing in your field suddenly seems to have a lot more weight. Next time you update your bio-data, resume on any site or for an application, don’t forget to mention that you are an author. You have now moved ahead of the competition. Notice how even well-known personalities like to display the title of being an “author” with their name and designation. 2. You now have something the print media can talk about – your book and in the process your skill, expertise and they let the world know about it. Go dig up that chance. Newspapers, radio talks, blogs and more. 3. This can become the basis to be invited to give a talk on the radio or at a college/literary festival. A talk on a topic on which the book is based or on the book itself or other topics that could emanate from the book. That’s a critical factor amongst many that Jaipur Literary Festival looks at. ‘Have you published a book in the preceding year?’ 4. Publishing a book establishes creditability for you as a person, entrepreneur and professional. Suddenly you are better known and recognized. It develops a feeling amongst the public that you are genuine (after all media has endorsed you) and safe for them to deal with. Go ahead play up your book! 5. Becoming an author improves your standing in your community/society. 6. Publishing a book is a testing of waters for your writing skills as an author. 7. It is a stepping stone to finally being recognized and lapped up by a large publishing company. 8. The last but not least, there is a fair chance that your confidence in your ability as a writer and a master salesman is not misplaced. You WERE right and your books are flying off the shelves! Good Luck!

Different people have different objectives in their minds when they choose to publish their books. Let’s look at some of the benefits of publishing a book Writing for Documentation: If you think you have a unique idea and it might be beneficial for the society, the best thing you can do is to write about them so that others can learn and improve on that. Never let your idea go ashtray; publish it.Create Your Own Brand: Even if becoming a writer is not your primary goal, you can still write a book to establish your brand. Writing a book is a great way to build on your reputation. Perhaps, it is the most sophisticated marketing strategy.Advance Your Career: You can advance your career exponentially through writing a book. The amount of hard work goes into the process of writing makes you almost an authority on your subject which means more people will now put their trust in you.Become a Best-selling Author: If writing is your bread and butter and you have got what it takes to become the best selling author, you probably know your checklists, starting from creating the right content to the appropriate marketing of your book.Writing as a Therapy for Others: The last few years have seen a rise of self-help books. These books help people overcome a personal obstacle. You may be surprised to know that your struggle story may be inspire others in the same situation and even prove to be a life-saving remedy.Share Information: This is one of the commonest reasons for writing books: Sharing your knowledge and experience on a specialized topic. If you possess any secret knowledge and advanced skills, You can share them by writing and publishing a book.Write as a Voice of Justice: Many people find a moral call from within and use their authorship to campaign against social injustice or political unrest. If you feel strongly against a raging issue of the time or a perpetual problem, you too can think about writing a book.So, keep writing and give a thought on publishing your book.
